0.0: An introduction of words and the beginning of speech,
0.1: Firstly, I take authorization and permission;
0.2: In two or three gates (units, stanzas), which I shall commence in trembling,
0.3: With permission from Him, Who created [man] and bears [his guilt] till senescence.
0.4: Eternal mighty acts are His, and there is no sufficient enumeration [for them],
0.5: [And] were the skies parchment, reed [pen]s all the forests;
0.6: Were the seas ink and all the assembled waters,
0.7: The inhabitants of the earth scribes, and writers of rəšūyōṯ (panegyrical hymns);
0.8: The glory of the Master of heaven and Ruler over the dry land,
0.9: Who set up the world single-handedly, and holds it in subjugation;
0.10: And without weariness completed it, and without feebleness,
0.11: And with a light letter (the letter He), which has no substance (contact between the articulators);
0.12: He prepared all his work in those six days,
0.13: The splendor of his honor He elevated onto His throne of fire.
0.14: A force of millions and myriads [of angels] to serve [Him],
0.15: They sprout anew in the mornings, abundant is [His] faithfulness;
0.16: More blazing [than them] are the Seraphim, adorned with six wings,
0.17: Till they are given a command, they remain silent in stillness;
0.18: They receive [the command] from one another simultaneously, without delay,
0.19: The honor of Him Who fills the entire earth to triple in sanctification;
0.20: Like a voice from the Almighty, like the sound of many waters,
0.21: Cherubs opposite Ophanim exalt in clamor;
0.22: To see before [their] face, an appearance like arrows of a bow,
0.23: Wherever they are sent, they [go] swiftly, in anxiousness;
0.24: They bless “Blessed be His honor,” in all tongues of incantation,
0.25: “From the location of the dwelling of His Presence,” which needs no searching;
0.26: The heavenly hosts roar, acclaim in apprehension,
0.27: “His reign shines for all generations, in perpetuity;”
0.28: [When] His sanctification is arranged, and when the hour passes,
0.29: [That is] the permanent end [of their duty], [which they do not resume] even after seven [years].
0.30: The lot of the honor of His estate (the Jewish people) is dear [to Him], for they regularly,
0.32: They are set aside as His portion, to do His will,
0.33: His wondrous praise they proclaim in speech;
0.34: He wishes, covets, and desires for them to exert themselves in [His] toil,
0.35: He therefore accepts their prayer, and [their] plea is effective;
0.36: It is bound unto the Eternal under oath as a diadem,
0.37: Opposite His honored frontlet (the head phylactery), it sits in firmness;
0.38: In which is written with wisdom and knowledge,
0.39: The greatness of Israel, [who] read in the teachings;
0.40: The praise of the Master of the universe, a likewise saying:
0.41: I thought it good to relate it before the kingdoms.
0.42: [The nations] come and gather, [their] appearance [is] like that of waves,
0.43: They wonder and ask her about the matter of the signs (wonders);
0.44: “Whence and who is your Beloved, O fair in appearance?
0.45: For due to Him, you are killed [in] the lion’s den (the exile);
0.46: You are honorable and beautiful, if you mingle into [our] dominions,
0.47: We will do your will in all places;”
0.48: In wisdom she replies to them, to make known the end,
0.49: “[If] you knew Him, in recognition [of His omnipotence];
0.50: Would your greatness be significant vis-à-vis that glory?
0.51: The greatness He will grant me, when salvation arrives;
0.52: When light comes to me, and shame will cover you,
0.53: When His honor is revealed, in strength and pride;
0.54: He enacts retribution on the foes and the isles,
0.55: Justice for a beloved people, abounding with merits;
0.56: Perfect joy, when [the exilees] come [in] neat garments,
0.57: When He gathers the exiles [to] the city of Jerusalem,
0.58: He casts His honor on it, day and night,
0.59: To make His canopy in it, crowned with praise;
0.60: The splendor of the clouds beautifies the veil,
0.61: According to [each one’s] work are the booths made [for them];
0.62: On foldstools of fine gold, with seven tiers;
0.63: Are the righteous demarcated before Him of the many acts;
0.64: Their appearance resembles the seven types of joy,
0.65: The sky in its splendor, and the splendid stars;
0.66: A glory that lips cannot detail,
0.67: And which has not been heard nor seen by the prophets [in their] visions;
0.68: In [a place] that no eye has gazed upon,0 inside the Garden of Eden,
0.69: They walk in a circle-dance along with the [Divine] Presence;
0.70: To Him they point, [saying:] “This is Him,” though in awe,
0.71: “In Him we placed our hope in our captivity, with strong faith;”
0.72: He leads us in eternity, [we] are compared (in vigor) to maidens,
0.73: [As] our portion from the Beginning He set aside as a heave;
0.74: The playful Leviathan and the proud mountain bull (Behemoth),
0.75: And when they are embroiled with each other and do battle;
0.76: With His horns, Behemoth gores in greatness,
0.77: Opposite him, the fish (Leviathan) leaps with his fins in might;
0.78: His creator pulls him closer with His sword in magnificence,
0.79: A banquet for the righteous He prepares [from them] and a meal;
0.80: They recline around Him with tables of carbuncle and precious stones,
0.81: Drawn out before them are rivers of balsam;
0.82: And they delight and sate themselves with  intoxicating cups,
0.83: Sweet wine, guarded in the vat since the Beginning.”
0.84: O meritorious [ones], just as you heard the praise of this song,
0.85: So will you have a fixed place in those fellowships (of the righteous in the world to come);
0.86: And you will merit to sit in the uppermost rank,
0.87: When you heed His words, uttered in glory;
0.88: Exalted is God, in the beginning and the end,
0.89: He took pleasure in us and wanted us, and taught us the Torah.
